title: Form of registers, etc.
content: 371.- (1) Any register, index, minute book or book of account required by this Law to be kept by a company may be kept either by making entries in bound books or by recording the matters in question in any other manner. 4 of 166 of 1987. (2) Where any such register, index, minute book or book of account is not kept by making entries in a bound book, but by some other means, adequate precautions shall be taken for guarding against falsification and facilitating its discovery, and where default is made in complying with this subsection, the company and every officer of the company who is in default shall be liable to a fine not exceeding four hundred twenty-seven euros and further shall be liable to a default fine. Service of documents on a company.
